info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:40AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southern Randolph, central Pocahontas, north central Nicholas, southeastern Upshur and Webster Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1038 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Birch River to 8 miles northwest of Webster Springs to 7 miles northeast of Holly River State Park. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Roads will quickly become covered with snow. Visibilities will rapidly drop to near white out conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Be prepared for low visibility and slippery roads. Slow down. Locations impacted include... Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Snowshoe, Holly River State Park, Camden On Gauley, Mingo, Cowen, Durbin, Huttonsville, Arbovale, Cheat Bridge, Upper Glade, Helvetia, Pickens, Waneta and Boyer. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 52 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
